body_html:
We don't have much experience with Zeppelin so it is tough to support this. Perhaps your problem is your are trying to graph unevaluated Tensors. Try eval or sess.run() on your tensor before trying to display it, however. i.e. try

import tensorflow as tf
x = tf.linspace(-3.0, 3.0, n_values)
sess=tf.Session()
xevald = sess.run(x)
plt.plot(xevald)
body_text:
We don't have much experience with Zeppelin so it is tough to support this. Perhaps your problem is your are trying to graph unevaluated Tensors. Try eval or  sess.run() on your tensor before trying to display it, however. i.e. try
import tensorflow as tf
x = tf.linspace(-3.0, 3.0, n_values)
sess=tf.Session()
xevald = sess.run(x)
plt.plot(xevald)
body:
We don't have much experience with Zeppelin so it is tough to support this. Perhaps your problem is your are trying to graph unevaluated Tensors. Try eval or  sess.run() on your tensor before trying to display it, however. i.e. try
```python
import tensorflow as tf
x = tf.linspace(-3.0, 3.0, n_values)
sess=tf.Session()
xevald = sess.run(x)
plt.plot(xevald)

```
